remarks: Propositions where a double-negative can be removed are called stable. See Chapter 2 [Moschovakis] p. 2. Our notation for stability is a connective ` STAB ` which we place before the formula in question.  For example, ` STAB x = y ` corresponds to "x = y is stable". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 13-Aug-2018.)
